required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Advanced Wireless, Wearable Sensors for Continuous Hemodynamic Monitoring
clinical_study.official_title: Advanced Wireless, Wearable Sensors for Continuous Hemodynamic Monitoring

brief_summary.textblock: Percent agreement of vital signs monitoring between the experimental sensor and standard of care monitoring

primary_outcome.measure: Percent agreement with pilot sensor and current standard of vital signs monitoring
primary_outcome.description: Percent agreement with pilot sensor and current standard of vital signs monitoring

arm_group.description: Adults scheduled to receive a TTE (Trans-esophogeal echocardiogram)

intervention.description: vital signs monitoring during standard of care procedures; TTE, swan-ganz catheterization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Patient's aged 18-65
2. Patient's scheduled to undergo a Trans-thoracic Echocardiogram (TTE) in an outpatient cardiology clinic or admitted to the Cardiac Care Unit with a swan ganz catheter in place for continuous invasive hemodynamic monitoring
Exclusion Criteria
1. Patient's with fragile skin or skin conditions that would prevent them from having a sensor placed
2. Patients undergoing exercise or drug induced cardiac stress test
3. Patients with a visible wound at site of sensor placement 3.4. Patients with structural or functional limitations to peripheral blood flow (known upper extremity peripheral arterial disease, use of vasopressors etc.).
